definition-item.definition-title: SCAFFOLDING; FORMS; SHUTTERING; BUILDING IMPLEMENTS OR AIDS, OR THEIR USE; HANDLING BUILDING MATERIALS ON THE SITE; REPAIRING, BREAKING-UP OR OTHER WORK ON EXISTING BUILDINGS

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Moulds for making units for prefabricated buildings or prefabricated stair units
Forms or shutterings of the construction, permanent or lost forms.
E04B, E04C

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Scaffold
Temporary platform or support

synonyms.paragraph-text: In patent documents, the following words/expressions are often used as synonyms:

definition-item.definition-title: Scaffolds primarily resting on the ground

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Workmen's or safety scaffolds i.e. temporary platforms or supports, supported mainly by the ground.
Scaffolds supported essentially by the building are classified in E04G3/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Component parts or accessories for scaffolds
Stagings, scaffolding, shores or struts usable both on slipways and in dry docks
Lifting devices for movable platforms or cabins, e.g. on vehicles, permitting workmen to place themselves in any desired position for carrying out required operations
Ladders in general, accessories specific therefor
Ladders with platforms
Platforms on, or for use on, ladders
Trestles (per se). Work benches, portable stands or supports for positioning portable tools or work to be operated on thereby of trestle type

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shelves characterised by their constructional features

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G1/18, B66F11/04: Lifting devices for movable platforms or cabins, e.g. on vehicles, permitting workmen to place themselves in any desired position for carrying out required operations are classified in B66F11/04; Scaffolds adjustable in height are classified in E04G1/18.

E04G1/32, F16M11/00, B25H1/08: Trestles per se are classified in F16M11/00; Work benches, portable stands or supports for positioning portable tools or work to be operated on thereby of trestle type are classified in B25H1/08; Scaffolds designed to provide support only at a low height using trestles are classified in E04G1/32.

E04G1/36, B65C5/02: Stagings, scaffolding, shores or struts usable both on slipways and in dry docks are classified in B65C5/02; Scaffolds for particular parts of buildings or buildings of particular shape are classified in E04G1/36.
E04G1/38; E04G3/00: Scaffolds both resting on the ground and supported by the building should be classified in E04G1/38 not E04G3/00.

definition-item.definition-title: essentially comprising special means for supporting or forming platforms (E04G1/20 takes precedence); Platforms (boards or planks therefor E04G5/08 {, clips or connections for securing boards E04G7/28})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Scaffolds essentially comprising special means for supporting or forming platforms i.e. scaffolds with specific fastening features on the scaffold frame or on the board for supporting or forming platforms, e.g. hooks and corresponding holes.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Scaffold boards or planks i.e. plain scaffold boards of planks without specific fastening features, e.g. hooks or corresponding holes.
Clips or connections for securing boards, i.e. clips which are part of neither the plank or board not the scaffold frame
Ladders with platforms
Platforms on, or for use on, ladders

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G1/15, E04G5/08, E04G7/28: Plain scaffold boards or planks without specific fastening means should be classified in E04G5/08; Clips or connecting means for securing boards, i.e. clips which are part of neither the plank or board nor of the scaffold frame should be classified in E04G7/28; Scaffolds essentially comprising specific fastening means on either the scaffold frame or on the board, e.g. hooks and corresponding holes, should be classified in E04G1/15.

definition-item.definition-title: Scaffolds essentially supported by building constructions, e.g. adjustable in height (E04G1/00 takes precedence {and E04G21/3204 takes precedence})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Workmen's or safety scaffolds (i.e. temporary platforms or supports) supported mainly by the building construction.
Scaffolds primarily resting on the ground are classified in E04G1/00. Scaffolds both resting on the ground and supported by the building are classified in E04G1/38 not in E04G3/00.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Scaffolds primarily resting on the ground
Component parts or accessories for scaffolds
Means for fastening, supporting, or bracing scaffolds on or against building constructions
Scaffold consoles or brackets

Safety or protective measures against falling down for persons during the construction of buildings, i.e. with the function of preventing or catching a fall and without the function of supporting the persons performing their normal work
Stagings, scaffolding, shores or struts usable both on slipways and in dry docks
Lifting devices for movable platforms or cabins, e.g. on vehicles, permitting workmen to place themselves in any desired position for carrying out required operations
Movable inspection or maintenance platforms, e.g. travelling scaffolding or vehicles specially designed to provide access to the undersides of bridges
Devices or arrangements allowing walking on the roof or in the gutter

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for cleaning building facades i.e. the gondolas carrying the cleaning device of such arrangements are similar to the scaffolds' gondolas, however do not provide a support function for persons

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G3/00, E04G5/06, E04G21/3204: Consoles or brackets to be fastened directly to the building and supporting persons performing their normal work are classified in E04G3/00; Consoles or brackets to be fastened directly to the building with the function of preventing or catching a fall and without the function of supporting the persons performing their normal work are classified in E04G21/3204; Consoles for scaffoldings are classified in E04G5/06.

definition-item.definition-title: Component parts or accessories for scaffolds (connections E04G7/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Accessories for scaffolds, in particular scaffolds' feet, fastening means to building construction, consoles or brackets, boards or planks, steps or ladders, canopies, railings and struts or stiffening rods, devices which are specifically designed to be attached to the scaffold and to store buildlng material or tools.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Scaffolds essentially comprising special means for supporting or forming platforms i.e. scaffolds with specific fastening features on the scaffold frame or on the board for supporting or forming platforms (e.g. hooks and corresponding holes, etc.)
Consoles or brackets essentially supported by building constructions and supporting persons performing their normal work
Connections between parts of the scaffold
Clips or connections for securing boards, i.e. clips which are part of neither the plank or board nor the scaffold frame
Safety or protective measures preventing damage to building parts or finishing work during construction

Safety or protective measures against falling down for persons during the construction of buildings, i.e. with the function of preventing or catching a fall and without the function of supporting the persons performing their normal work
Temporary arrangements for giving access from one level to another for men or vehicles, e.g. steps, ramps
Ladders in general
Fastenings in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shelves characterised by their constructional features

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G5/00, E04G21/3204: Safety or protective measures against falling down for persons during the erection of scaffolding should be classified in E04G5/00 not in E04G21/3204.

E04G3/00, E04G5/06, E04G21/3204: Consoles or brackets to be fastened directly to the building and supporting persons performing their normal work are classified in E04G3/00; Consoles or brackets to be fastened directly to the building with the function of preventing or catching a fall and without the function of supporting the persons performing their normal work are classified in E04G21/3204; Consoles for scaffoldings are classified in E04G5/06.

E04G5/08, E04G1/15, E04G7/28: Plain scaffold boards or planks without specific fastening means should be classified in E04G5/08; Clips or connecting means for securing boards, i.e. clips which are part of neither the plank or board not the scaffold frame are classified in E04G7/28; scaffolds essentially comprising specific fastening means on either the scaffold frame or on the board, e.g. hooks and corresponding holes are classified in E04G1/15.
E04G5/10, E04G27/00: Steps or ramps as construction implements or construction aid are classified in E04G27/00; Steps for scaffolds are classified in E04G5/10

E04G5/12, E04G21/24: Details of scaffolds' canopies should be classified in E04G5/12; Details about the use of scaffoldings with canopies to protect buildings during construction should be classified in E04G21/24.

definition-item.definition-title: Connections between parts of the scaffold (for building structures in general E04B1/38; connections in general F16B {; connection for tubes or rods in general F16B7/00})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Connection between parts of the scaffold, e.g. with separate coupling elements e.g. ropes, cables, chains, clamps or with non-detachable coupling elements.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Scaffolds essentially comprising special means for supporting or forming platforms i.e. scaffolds with specific fastening features on the scaffold frame or on the board for supporting or forming platforms, e.g. hooks and corresponding holes.
Mobile scaffolds; Scaffolds with mobile platforms suspended by flexible supporting elements, e.g. cables.

Accessories for scaffolds, in particular scaffolds' feet, fastening means to building construction, consoles or brackets, boards or planks, steps or ladders, canopies, railings and struts or stiffening rods.
Scaffold boards or planks i.e. plain scaffold boards of planks without details of specific fastening features, e.g. hooks or corresponding holes.
Connections for (permanent) building structures in general
Connections in general
Connections of rods or tubes in general
Means for fastening cables or ropes to one another or to other objects

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G7/28, E04G1/15, E04G5/08: Plain scaffold boards or planks without specific fastening means are classified in E04G5/08; Clips or connecting means for securing boards, i.e. clips which are part of neither the plank or board not the scaffold frame are classified in E04G7/28; scaffolds essentially comprising specific fastening means on either the scaffold frame or on the board, e.g. hooks and corresponding holes, are classified in E04G1/15.

definition-item.definition-title: Forming or shuttering elements for general use {(for prefabrication of concrete elements in a plant B28B7/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Forming or shuttering elements for general use, re-usable and to be used in situ.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forms, shutterings, or falsework for making walls, floors, ceilings, or roofs, i.e. formworks showing features specific for the casting of walls, floors, ceiling

Falsework, forms, or shutterings for particular parts of buildings, e.g. stairs, steps, cornices, balconies, i.e. formworks showing features specific for the casting of particular parts of buildings, e.g. stairs, steps, cornices, balconies.
Forms or shutterings for making (i.e. formworks showing features specific for the casting of openings, cavities, slits, or channels) cf. .
Moulds; Cores; Mandrels to be used for prefabrication of elements in prefabrication plants rather than in-situ.

table-column.paragraph-text: Building elements of relatively thin form for the construction of parts of buildings, e.g. sheet materials, slabs, or panels

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G9/00, B28B7/00: forms to be used in situ are classified in E04G9/00, forms to be used in prefabrication plants are classified in B28B7/00.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Forms, shutterings, or falsework for making walls, floors, ceilings, or roofs, re-usable and to be used in situ.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Forming or shuttering elements for general use

Props, struts or chocks for the construction

Walls made by casting, pouring, or tamping in situ made in permanent forms rather than in re-usable forms
Floor structures wholly cast in situ with or without form units or reinforcements, i.e. floors with lost forms rather than re-usable forms

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G11/00, B28B7/22: Forms to be used in situ are classified in E04G11/00; Forms to be used in prefabrication plants are classified in B28B7/22.
E04G11/00, E04B5/32, E04B1/167, E04B2/86: Re-usable forms are classified in E04G11/00; Lost forms are classified in E04B5/32, E04B1/167 or E04B2/86.

definition-item.definition-title: Falsework, forms, or shutterings for particular parts of buildings, e.g. stairs, steps, cornices, balconies {foundations, sills (E04G11/365 takes precedence; flat foundations, e.g. with lost forms E02D27/01; removable forms or shutterings for road-building purposes E01C19/50)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Falsework, forms, or shutterings for particular parts of buildings, e.g. stairs, steps, cornices, balconies, re-usable and to be used in situ.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Stop-end shutterings for floors, ceilings, or roofs of plane or curved surfaces
Moulds for making units for prefabricated buildings in a prefabrication site rather than in situ; Moulds for making prefabricated stair units in a prefabrication site rather than in situ
Removable forms or shutterings for road-building purposes
Flat foundations with lost forms rather than re-usable forms

Columns; Pillars; Struts of concrete other stone-like material, with or without permanent form elements, with or without internal or external reinforcement, e.g. metal coverings using permanent forms rather than in re-usable forms
Stairways; Layouts thereof, which are using permanent forms rather than in re-usable forms

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G13/00, E02D27/01: Re-usable forms for foundations are classified in E04G13/00, foundations with lost forms are classified in E02D27/01.
E04G13/02, E04C3/34: Re-usable forms for columns are classified in E04G13/02, columns with lost forms are classified in E04C3/34.

E04G13/06, B28B7/225, E04F11/02: Re-usable forms for stairs to be used in situ are classified in E04G13/06, forms for stairs to be used in a prefabrication plant are classified in B28B7/225, stairs elements with lost shuttering are classified in E04F11/02.

definition-item.definition-title: Forms or shutterings for making openings, cavities, slits, or channels (forming part of shuttering for walls E04G11/06 {, e.g. double walls E04G11/18; prefabricated elements with elements wholly or partly embedded therein B28B23/00; core or mandrels for the prefabrication of concrete elements B28B7/28})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Forms or shutterings for making openings, cavities, slits, or channels, to be used in situ.

table-column.paragraph-text: Forms forming part of shuttering for walls, e.g. double walls E04G11/18
Forms forming part of shuttering for double walls
Means in or on the elements for connecting same to handling apparatus, i.e. anchors in or on building elements specially adapted for handling these elements
Templates or adjusting tools for anchoring elements or elements to be incorporated in the structure

Arrangements specially adapted for the production of shaped articles with elements wholly or partly embedded in the moulding material, to be used in the prefabrication process in prefabrication plants; Core or mandrels to be used in the prefabrication process in prefabrication plants
Installations of electric cables or lines in or on buildings, distribution boxes

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G15/04, E04G21/142: Cores for the anchors are classified in E04G15/04; Anchors per se are classified in E04G21/142.

E04G15/00, B28B23/00, B28B23/005, B28B23/0056, B28B7/28: Forms or shutterings for making openings, re-usable or lost, to be used in situ are classified in E04G15/00; Forms or shutterings for making openings, to be used in the prefabrication process in prefabrication plants are classified in B28B23/00, B28B23/005, B28B23/0056, B28B7/28
E04G15/06, H02G3/08: electric distribution boxes are classified in H02G3/08 not in E04G15/06.

Connecting or other auxiliary members for forms, falsework structure, or shutterings, for re-usable forms to be used in situ.

Forms for vertical ducts
Forms for columns
Struts fro the construction
Walls made by casting, pouring, or tamping in situ made in permanent forms with ties going through the forms. i.e. ties for lost forms

section-body.paragraph-text: E04G17/04, E04B2/8647: Ties for re-usable forms are classified in E04G17/04; Ties for lost forms are classified in E04B2/8647.

Lubricating compositions

table-column.paragraph-text: Building

In this group, the expression building defines a house, school, a store, etc. In this group, the expression building excludes other specialized civil works constructions such as bridges, dams, oil platform, nuclear plants, etc., working measures on such specialised constructions is usually dealt with in the subclasses/groups relating to these constructions
